input.description: The name of the adapter to use to handle the request. Default adapter name: InfobloxNIOS.

Creates a new DNS record in Infoblox appliance. Supported DNS Records are A,PTR,CNAME,SRV,TXT,MX.
Generic sample item.xml
<items> <item> <target> <host>localhost</host> <user-name>admin</user-name> <password encryption-type="Base64">YWRtaW4=</password> <timeout-secs>120</timeout-secs> </target> <parameters> <record-type>A</record-type> <comment>user comment</comment> <dns-view>default</dns-view> <disable>true</disable> <ip-address>10.0.0.0</ip-address> <ptr-name>www.corp100.com</ptr-name> <a-name>admin.demo.com</a-name> <canonical-name>10.0.0.1.0.0.10.in-addr.arpa</canonical-name> <cname-name>1.0.0.10.in-addr.arpa</cname-name> <srv-name>admin.demo.com</srv-name> <srv-port>11</srv-port> <srv-priority>10</srv-priority> <srv-weight>10</srv-weight> <srv-target>admin.demo.com</srv-target> <txt-string>This is the infomrations which will be associsated with the TXT record</txt-string> <txt-name>admin.demo.com</txt-name> <mx-preference>10</mx-preference> <mx-exchanger>10.0.0.12</mx-exchanger> <mx-domain-name>admin.demo.com</mx-domain-name> <scheduled-at>2012-12-05T18:30:19+05:30</scheduled-at> <extensible-attributes> <attribute> <key>Site</key> <value>sample site</value> </attribute> </extensible-attributes> </parameters> </item> </items>

record-type[Required] Type of DNS record type , valid values : A,PTR,CNAME,SRV,TXT,MX
comment[optional] A comment in string format. Default is empty
dns-view[Optional ] The DNS view in which the record to be created . By default, record will be created in default DNS view.
disable[Optional ] disable flag of a DNS record Valid values true,false . Default value is "false"
extensible-attributes[optional] Specify the extensible attributes for the record. E.g. Site, site etc.
ip-address[Conditional] The IPv4 or IPv6 address to which you want the domain name to map ex.10.0.0.0 , Required if DNS object of type PTR or type A is specified as record-type . Note : for record type A, only supported address is IPV4.
ptr-name[Conditional] hostname to which you want the PTR record to point. For example. www.corp100.com. Required if DNS object of type PTR is specified as record-type.
a-name[Conditional] name of the host in FQDN (Fully Qualified Domain Name) format. ex - admin.demo.com (here admin is hostname and demo.com is authoritative forward-mapping zone ) . if the zone name is demo.com and you want admin as a hostname, then the FQDN becomes admin.corp100.com. Ensure that the domain name you enter complies with the hostname restriction policy defined for the zone. Required if DNS object of type A is specified as record-type .
canonical-name [Conditional] To add a CNAME record to a forward-mapping zone, enter the complete canonical (or official) name of the host. To add a CNAME record to a reverse-mapping zone, enter host_ip_addr.prefix.network.in-addr.arpa (host IP address + 2317 prefix + network IP address + in-addr.arpa). For example, enter 10.0.0.1.0.0.10.in-addr.arpa. Required if DNS object of type CNAME is specified as record-type .
cname-name [Conditional] A name in FQDN (Fully Qualified Domain Name) format. The FQDN consists of the host_name followed by the domain name (example: abc.com). ex: 1.0.0.10.in-addr.arpa Required if DNS object of type CNAME is specified as record-type .
srv-name[Conditional] A name in FQDN (Fully Qualified Domain Name). ex - admin.demo.com (here admin is hostname and demo.com is authoritative forward-mapping zone ) . if the zone name is demo.com and you want admin as a hostname, then the FQDN becomes admin.demo.com Required if DNS object of type SRV is specified as record-type .
srv-port[Conditional] The port of the SRV record ex: 10. Required if DNS object of type SRV is specified as record-type.
srv-priority[Conditional] The priority of the SRV record ex:11 . Required if DNS object of type SRV is specified as record-type
srv-weight[Conditional] The weight of the SRV record ex:11. Required if DNS object of type SRV is specified as record-type.
srv-target[Conditional] The canonical domain name of the host (not an alias); for example, admin.demo.com (where demo.com is forward-mapping zone ) , Required if DNS object of type SRV is specified as record-type.
txt-string[Conditional] Enter the text that you want to associate with the record. It can contain substrings of up to 255 bytes, up to a total of 512 bytes. Required if DNS object of type TXT is specified as record-type.
txt-name[Conditional] if you want to create a TXT record for a web server whose host name is admin.demo.com and you define the TXT record in the 'demo.com' authoritative forward-mapping zone , enter admin.demo.com in this field. . Required if DNS object of type TXT is specified as record-type.
mx-preference[Conditional] The preference value of the DNS shared MX object. Preference value of shared MX record for the zone range from 0 to 65535. Required if DNS object of type MX is specified as record-type.
mx-exchanger[Conditional] The name of the mail exchanger in Fully Qualified Domain Name (FQDN) format. Required if DNS object of type MX is specified as record-type.
mx-domain-name[Conditional] A domain name in Fully Qualified Domain Name (FQDN) format, for example - For example, if you want to create an MX record for a mail exchanger serving admin.demo.com—a subdomain of demo.com—and you define the MX record in the demo.com zone, enter admin.demo.com in this field.If you want to define an MX record for a domain and all its subdomains, enter an asterisk ( *.demo.com ) to create a wildcard MX record. Required if DNS object of type MS is specified as record-type.
scheduled-at[Optional] Specify the date time on which operation need to be executed. Date and time are represented in ISO 8601 extended format (e.g., 2008-10-21T10:56:00Z or 2008-10-21T10:56:00.001Z) with some restrictions. When the scheduling parameter is used, changes do not occur immediately. Instead at the date time specified in this parameter.

output.description: Returned adapter response is captured in this context parameter.
